column4: I'm having a heck of a time getting cron to display a gui app...I've tried dozens of variations trying to set the DISPLAY variable and I still get nothing...What does the value 0 represent exactly?
I use this line it might help 0 *     * * *   export DISPLAY=:0 && gdesklets restart
I tried that exactly, except for the restart portiong...I just tried to open an app new, and I get nothing...
try with start maybe , restart is just for my own setup
"how" are you editing cron ?
Tried adding restart and still nothing...sudo crontab -e....
is this an app that needs to run as root ?    like an antivirus ?  cause if not just do crontab -e to run it for the user
can I see the line ?
I take it you don'T want deluge to run all the time ?
nope, I'm on satellite connection and only have unlimited bandwidth for 3 hours late at night
can you run  deluge  regularly ? I just mean to start it , because I haven'T been able to start it on my computer
you might consider using  utorrent on wine  it has a schedular in it
yeah, I downloaded v0.5.2 earlier today and it works fine
ok so first donT' run it as  root,   just use crontab -e not sudo crontab
I'll give it a try without using root...
try this line in  crontab -e   41 *     * * *   export DISPLAY=:0 && deluge
the small amount of bandwidh is probably  dht and scrapping,  you might want to turn those off
Man, I'm an idiot...I've been at this for hours...the non-sudo crontab did the trick...thanks a bunch for the help
you're welcome , I take visa
fyi  only use sudo crontab  for jobs that require root access
Lesson learned
